WRITING.TEXT: every. damn. day. :P
Breads. Bagels work well for me, with just a little tiny bit of cream cheese for flavor. Croissants. things like that. Sometimes rice. Bananas are usually ok too.
ugh popcorn is my nightmare. i ate some this week and was in pain for 3 days. It's crazy how IBS is so different for different people.

I wish it were that easy for me. Once im at work im ok, but in the mornings i go like 3-5x and im doubled over in pain. i cant seem to leave my apartment until its subsided so im late for work like 3x a week. Thank god my boss knows about the IBS but still. Its miserable. Its hard to find a place to take a shit when commuting on the NYC subway.
Chatting with whoever is my company for the trip. Otherwise, when i went solo, i brought a PS Vita. video games in line makes the line move so much faster ;)
I havent been on (through?) the Tiki room in AGES. Skip it every time.
No, but it can stop other things. There's no harm in it.
Caught a 632CP porygon, just walking to work, in the east village in NYC.

I live in NYC. I just bought an AP with the thought of doing 1 long trip and at least 2 quick trips in a year. I have done 3 days twice, leaving very early morning and taking a late flight home to maximize time. My next trip is only 4 days, thursday to sunday.
Fantasmic runs for 26 minutes. So unless you are willing to see like..5 minutes of it then leave to have time to walk out, chances are you'll have to watch either/or :-/
That Lost Boys bust! love it!

or people can use it to kill time in line, or while sitting and waiting for others to finish their meal, or sitting and waiting for the fireworks/parade etc. yes there probably will be people wandering and looking at their phones, but...people do that A LOT now as it is. I've seen it in the parks all the time. If that is their typical behavior, that behavior won't change. But, if this game can make the "waiting" aspects of disney more bearable, then cool. Also...it's a super fun game :) it actually interacts with landmarks in your neighborhood so i find it actually gets me out more and going to places i don't normally.
Riding everest at night. Havent been since they extended AK hours so Im excited for that new experience!
Honestly, 90 minutes has always been the far end of the wait. usually its more like 60 for me.
40 here!

I listen to a lot of park music, on my way to work or at work. I watch some vlogs and i also try to fit in a few disney movies on during my countdown :) I also have my own youtube channel where I do disney centric videos, and doing that helps me let out the excitement somewhere! 40 days!!!
Hopefully it's just the weekend. I'm there 21st to 28th and hope to see decent crowds otherwise

My stools are like this almost daily no matter what I eat. Fluffy and jagged edges and in bits and pieces and sometimes floating. I haven't found a reason yet. Did all the testing i could do, including stool tests, but drs didn't find anything wrong in particular. I also have a drink only 1-2 days a week or sometimes less but even when i dont drink at all it happens. Sorry this didnt provide answers, more just a way of saying, im in the same boat as you and looking for the same answers!

WRITING.TITLE: Headless Nick Won't Talk To Me In Cellar
WRITING.TEXT: Hi all, I'm on the quest Warming the Crowd in the enhanced edition. I have stolen headless nick, he tells me to take him to reginald's cellar to talk in private. I drop him there and try to talk to him and he yells at me as if we're not in reginald's cellar. Is this a glitch? How can i progress?

I'll be there myself, the 18th to the 21st! We'll be at All Star Sports. Pack ponchos, it will rain (but it'll feel great). Expect to be up early if you really want to get the most of your days. Take breaks if you need to. The heat can be a doozy, don't push yourself anymore than you can.

Food: Dole whips. Im incomplete without one. sometimes i get multiple.
Shows: Voices of Liberty in the American pavilion. Dapper Dans.
Rides: Haunted Mansion. Space Mountain. Mission: Space. Everest. Rock n Rollercoaster. Tower of Terror (im a bit of a thrill seeker if you cant tell!)

Orange is the only way i ride it, ive never done green. It is not bad at ALL. if you have any motion sickness, then dont. If youve done other coasters and simulations fine, you'll be fine. it is NOT nearly as intense as people say it is. Promise. If you have a history of being just fine with thrill rides, you'll be ok here.
I think they meant on property, since they have the dining plan!

Longest standby I ever waited was 2 hours for RnR, about a few weeks into opening. It was supposed to be an hour, but it broke down while my brother and I were half way through the line, so we just stuck it out.
Kona Cafe for breakfast is great. Crystal Palace breakfast was great too, plus characters! 50s Prime Time i encourage, if you don't mind a bit of ribbing humor with your meal!
This is also very true for Fastpasses! Always keep checking, you never know when people are going to cancel! great advice :)
You need to call them to pay off the rest of your account. Can't do it online.

WRITING.TITLE: Resort Hopping...Experiences?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm curious if anyone here has resort hopped before during a stay. I am resort hopping twice in January and I know Disney can bring your bags over to the new resort. How long does that take? I assume I still have to check out as planned (or they'll auto check me out, like they did my last trip) and then i need to check in to my subsequent resort. was the process easy, if you've done it before?
I live in NYC so I'm in the same boat. But Jetblue's two hubs are NYC and Orlando, so it works very well for me! (i also have their credit card). You just gotta wait for those flight sales!!!

nope! as long as you are fully paid off, have a CC attached, and fill out the full check in, you can go right to your room with your magicband!

you know, these are the things we need to tell ourselves!

I've done a series of videos on traveling solo. I have [one that's overall tips](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2x_K-oivbBs) that might help you!
Other than that, don't be hesitant. do it! I went on a whim and it ended up being the best trip i've had in YEARS. Everything is at your own pace and you owe nothing to anybody.

WRITING.TITLE: Finally Bought My AP...then Booked an Impromptu Trip for August. oops.
WRITING.TEXT:
So I took the plunge and bought the annual pass (thanks to people here for all your information on that!) and was like, ok great now I'm set for my January trip next year and any trips after!....then my friend, who also just bought an AP said... im looking at a long weekend in August... "I can do August!"
Oops. Looks like we're doing a 4-day trip in 55 days.

I already had dates booked through a friends DVC, but im flying in a day early so i booked that 1 night :)
After next paycheck I believe I'm going to book for October as well, to have something solid.
It'll get here before you know it ;)

any idea on where you want to stay?

WRITING.TEXT: Assuming what we've all heard is correct, tomorrow 2017 rates should be released and we should be able to book online. I already have some dates booked in Jan through a friends DVC, but I need to finish out some bookend dates on that week AND since I thinking of an AP for next year, i may just book a trip in October as well! I am SO EXCITED for tomorrow to come...but I'd be so bummed if for some reason the rates didn't get released haha. Anyone else in the same boat? What are you planning on booking? **EDIT: THEY'RE UP! HUZZAH!**

I'll be there with some friends the 21st to 28th. Good time of year to go! Reasonable crowds. You'll get a lot done per day. Bring layers for sure! You never know when you'll be OK in a t-shirt during the day and then need a hoodie later. Either have a big enough bag to bring to the parks or dont be shy about taking resort breaks to change.

WRITING.TITLE: Nausea Followed By BM?
WRITING.TEXT: so this is a new symptom of my IBS-D, but lately, i get extreme nausea almost where i think im going to puke, then a few minutes later, stomach ache, then D. It's not every time i have a problem, but probably once every 2-3 weeks. I've never had this before; is this common for IBS? I've had all the other tests for everything else, but that was 3 years ago, and so I want to make sure it's not something I should be concerned about as a new symptom.

I've been also doing research into an AP for next year. I got all the information I could ever need on perks [here](http://allears.net/pl/apass.htm) and I believe its 365 days from when you first use the AP (first day of activation), not from when you get the voucher/first purchase. That way you can purchase ahead of time, if you have the $ now and thats easier.

Uber is way cheaper than regular area cabs over there. I never paid more than $10 to get anywhere, a couple of times from resort to resort like... $5. It was awesome to myself who lives in NYC and is used to Uber and every other cab service charging an arm and a leg.
224 days. Right there with you.
I updated the post some time ago but I have no more keys :( sorry!
Hey, thanks for reaching out but I'm out of keys :-/ Sorry!

haha sorry, there were several PMs that came in prior! but I'm hoping I'll be getting more. I had quite a few cases where they sent me keys that were already used so I reached out to try and get replacements.

I brought along my boyfriend, who as a good sport but not a disney world fan, came for me. He really disliked the parks, though did enjoy dinners at resorts, parasailing ,etc. In the first few days, i really guilted him about not ruining my vacation. I really should have just been more lenient, understood it wasnt his favorite thing, and let him go take breaks mid day, instead of making him feel bad about it (though in my defense, he complained a LOT haha). Still, i could've handled it better too.
We now agree that he won't be coming back until we have future kids, but that I'll be going plenty with friends + solo. Sometimes you just gotta accept someone isn't going to love every single thing you love!
yeesh! my longest render is maybe 30 minutes. That's insane.

WRITING.TITLE: Giving Away Handful of Keys to Dead by Daylight Beta
WRITING.TEXT: Hi guys! So, I had the opportunity to go to PAX East in April and came across a game called Dead by Daylight. It's a little hard to explain other than it's a multiplayer, classic horror style game. One killer, 4 victims trying to survive. They recently sent me an email with a BUTTLOAD of keys for beta this week, which makes sense considering it's a multiplayer beta. Need people playing to be fun, right? Anyway, I'd like to give them out to you guys because you've been such an awesome community to be a part of. So, please send me a PM and i'll give away what ive got :) It's on Steam, and PC only I'm afraid. [Check out the game here](http://www.deadbydaylight.com/) **EDIT: All keys have been given away! Thanks for reaching out, guys! Hope to see you on the game this week :)**

WRITING.TITLE: Hell Guard Glitch
WRITING.TEXT: So.. I'm playing against the hell guard, finally kicking it's ass. I run up, do the glory kill.... and then... it's somehow still alive? And it does the flames in a circle move, but they don't circle around, and then it just disappeared. And then there's just fire shooting everywhere, and the other 2 hell guards don't show up. I can't do anything but jump around the flames. I kill myself by burning myself to death, and sure enough it didn't checkpoint or anything, so I have to restart the boss fight all over again. Sweet glitch. /sarcasm.
So excited for you! I'll be picking one up for next year and I live in NYC but totally worth paying for other travel to make a few trips out :)

I second this. I get hemorrhoids a lot from straining due to IBS, the blood is always bright red or even pink (As in, bare traces of it). It's never usually "lots" either. anything darker usually means internal bleeding of some kind.

Talk to your boss. Co-workers dont need to know, necessarily, but talk to your boss. Really. I told mine and she's well aware that if i text and say "upset stomach, going to be a little late" that IBS is the problem and she is accommodating. It's worth it to confide in someone so it doesnt reflect poorly on you.
I've held back on making my vlog about IBS public on my youtube channel...but this makes me want to do it. Thank you for being so brave!

WRITING.TITLE: Word of Warning.... Don't Eat "White Tuna"
WRITING.TEXT:
So I'm an idiot. I ordered sushi for lunch today and didn't pay that much attention to the tuna i ordered. I ordered "white tuna" instead of regular tuna. That was a bad idea. Turns out a lot of places sell a fish called escolar as "white tuna". It's not tuna at all and it's known to have an oil people can't digest, so it's called the "ex-lax fish". I am so glad that I only ate 2 pieces of the sushi roll before I found this out. A co worker was like "oh, dont worry you need to eat like 6 oz before it makes you sick." Well, they don't know I have IBS. I may have ingested about 2, 2.5 oz but within 20 minutes I was running to the bathroom. Peeing. out. my. butt.
I am doing better now, an hour later + imodium. But word to the wise... dont do white tuna/escolar. Not even a little bit.

WRITING.TITLE: Is It Worth It To Get a Disney World Annual Pass?

WRITING.TEXT: I don't censor myself, nor do i "try too hard" with swearing. If it comes naturally, cool. I'll leave it in, because thats me, thats my reaction to scary games or certain moments in stories. So i dont censor myself.

I'mo a native New yorker, and am especially interesting in seeing how real to the city it is. In fact, id love to do a whole series playing the game as the stereotypical new yorker, like an in character sort of thing. That'd be super fun. So sure, id love to try and win the copy!

While enjoying the pool with a couple of friends at Wilderness Campgrounds, we were taking turns on the slide. This was a couple of years ago, i was about 26, 27. I had a bikini top on that had ties for both behind the neck and behind my back and let me tell you, the fabric they give is just not enough to keep those ties tight. The friction of the pool slide undid that top neck tie, completely. Luckily I realized this as i entered the pool and didn't actually lose the top, but held it real close to me as i kept my body underwater and retied it. I almost flashed a bunch of little kids that day, plus my best guy friend. Needless to say, i chucked that bikini for a more secure new one!
Did this on my last trip. It was awesome. Saved my battery too.

I've been doing a playthrough of SOMA which is very story driven. I leave most of my episodes around 20 minutes because cutting things out wouldn't make sense. I just cut out moments where maybe it took me 15 minutes to figure out a puzzle, because no one needs to see that struggle...unless it's funny.

I mean, they are advertised (or not) just as much as any other snack in the parks. You wander and try things and thats how you learn about most of them. I prefer the lines now...we don't need them longer ;)
I havent been there since early march and I'm missing it a ton. already planning my January trip to make myself feel better!
Also can confirm as an NYC resident. They are a Brooklyn born company.

I have the Yachtsman Steakhouse one and the California Grill and i love it. Definitely makes me happy to have a taste of disney at home. I think the coffee's pretty good. Definitely nothing fancy but better than most crap in my grocery store.
awesome! thank you for the update!

There is also "nothing wrong with me" either. And yet ive been suffering with this "nothing wrong" for 3 years. Luckily my dr understands nothing specific doesn't mean im not ill so she's been great. But still, it sort of sucks to not have an "answer." I get it. I'm sorry :(
no no i mean... literally in public haha. I don't REALLY wish it, its kind of gross...but at the same time it's like ugh. I dont want to suffer just trying to get to a bathroom!
awesome! please keep us updated on how it goes.

I think you can compromise here. I think you may want to work on your anxiety a bit. It's something I've had to do myself but then I'm able to say, travel and go on vacation with my boyfriend, or go out to a bar, or what have you At the same time you work on that, he needs to understand that it makes you just as sad when you ARE too sick to go out, and its nothing against him. He can try and be more supportive in those scenarios where doing something fun just isn't an option. I think if you both work on it from your ends, you'll be OK. My boyfriend and I have been together 4 years, 3.5 of those I've had IBS. We're going strong because we try to be empathetic to each other around the problem. Also, sometimes we come to a compromise that I don't feel well but he should still go out and be social with his friends etc. and not feel guilty. But i think because we've been together so long that's a little easier to do.

WRITING.TITLE: Does Anyone Else Have Weird Thoughts Around IBS?
WRITING.TEXT: Like, often (and this morning), as I'm walking to work and not feeling well I think "I wish it was acceptable in American society to just poop in public. I'd never have a problem again." It's kind of a random thought but I mean...I'd never fear having an accident, right? Do any of you ever think kind of weird things when you're suffering?
someone did that here in NYC once. I don't want to presume Chinese, but an Asian mother made her daughter squat and pee right on the sidewalk. She had a dress on but still. Wat.

A Dark Souls 3 Silent Film Comedy/Tragedy
WRITING.TEXT: A friend of mine and I were playing co op very late last night, as he wanted to help me with the area just past the pontiff. WRITING.TITLE: Tips for Dining in Disney World Solo

WRITING.TEXT: In that case then, showing them the voucher wouldn't be enough, I assume?

2 days is definitely not enough time, unless you are doing only the Magic Kingdom. You have 4 parks and on my recent trip, in 3 days I only did 3 of them and felt rushed. 5 days is ideal minimum amount of time. If the cost of rooms offsite is cheaper for you than a value hotel at disney (which range from about $89 to $120 or so depending on time of year) then definitely go for it, if you've got transportation locked down. The benefit to onsite is free transportation (ie, buses from hotels to parks).
Remember that the more days you go to parks, the cheaper (per day cost) the tickets are. Play around with the prices on the site and you'll see what I mean. If park hopping doesn't matter to you, meaning going to multiple parks in a single day, you can save by eliminating that option on your tickets.
Thanks guys! Very helpful.

I literally just went alone about 5 weeks ago. Ive been posting [some vlogs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OqjhnGVqcKc) of it over the past several weeks, if you care to see what it was like first hand. No one cares. Really! It was quite possibly the best vacation down there I've had in years. Single rider lines are awesome. You get to do whatever you want, whenever you want, eat whatever you want, wake up whenever you want... etc etc. I had a HELL of a time. I only went for 3 days and it was too rushed, i think 5 days will be wonderful!

WRITING.TITLE: Annual Pass Question
WRITING.TEXT: Hi Everyone, considering my first annual pass next year after 11+ trips to the world. I forsee an 8 day trip coming up and then likely a 4-5 day one later in the year. Anyway, I live in NYC, so I know that when you buy an AP, you get a voucher which you then have to turn in for the actual pass at the parks, which is then activated. SO, does this mean that some of the special hotel discounts I could get for being a passholder, would NOT be able to be applied for my first trip, because I'd have to book the hotel before I had a chance to get down here an activate my pass?

I always enjoyed streets of america. I'm from NYC, born and raised, and i loved giggling at the Disney version of NY. it seemed...too clean, too perfect. But i enjoyed it, at the same time. My mom, originally from the bronx, used to looove walking down that one side street going towards Star Wars that has the apartmen stoops. She said one in particular looked just like the one she grew up hanging out on. It was always nice to stroll through here, and enjoy the quietest area of the park. I'll miss it for the nostalgia, but im happy to see something new come about.
I alternate between the Madewell kind of style and Modcloth kind of style. I accept this now!
It's not only my favorite disney movie, it may be one of my favorite overall movies of all time. It's a beautiful, wonderful film that doesn't get enough love.
Do you take commissions? I'm being serious. I think you've got an awesome talent, and it totally made me want a Hunchback drawing of Esmeralda or Clopin :)

If that's how they choose to tell the story, than that's how I'll play the story. It's like asking me if I wouldn't read a book with a male protagonist.
I also don't care when it's multiplayer. I choose who i like the best, that may not always be the female character. In games like Rainbow Six Siege, where each have their own abilities, I always pick Sledge, a dude, because I love his abilities. I don't care at all that he's male and i don't wish he was female. I guess i just don't care enough/think about it enough. I'd feel more burned if someone picked a character i wanted for their perks, but never for their gender.

I hate Stitch. A lot of people love him, i find him crazy annoying and my hate for him stems from him taking over my fav ride, Alien Encounter. I know my hatred is unfounded and silly... but I still hold to it.
WEIRD. :D

I actually recently found out im allergic to red meat. Beef, pork, lamb, which always gave me problems. so now ive totally cut them out. It helps in terms of cutting out a definite issue, but i still have problems all the time with random foods.
So glad you've enjoyed it here! I find once I'm on my trips i am having too much fun to think about my stomach or let anxiety make it worse. It's just the traveling between that's tough.

Yup Imodium is my best friend and often the only way i can get out the door to work. My movements are the same. Loose, not normal, but only real diarrhea about once every 6 weeks or so, often for no reason. But generally they are loose enough they cause worry when I'm commuting, especially since i take public transportation. It's like life ruining, worrying so much.
